verbose_text: Acetazolamide is a classic example of selective impairment of HCO3- reabsorption since there this is the only defect and there is no loss of glucose or amino acids.5 Topiramate also causes selective type II RTA by inhibiting carbonic anhydrase II, the predominant renal isoenzyme of carbonic anhydrase.4, 6 In type II RTA, the reabsorption of HCO3- in the distal tubule is unaffected.
evidence: Topiramate also causes selective type II RTA by inhibiting carbonic anhydrase II
